titleStmt.title: J. L. Mager et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8851

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To his Excellency Gov. Robinson your petitioners the Jurors who tried the cases & citizens of Harrison County respectfully represent that at a called term of the Harrison Circuit Court held May 15th 1863 H C Neble was convicted of Suffering gaming in his house (he being a tavern keeper) and also of permitting a slave in his employment to sell liquor at his bar Mr Neble is an industrious orderly & loyal citizen of this county and we are staisfied that the games played in his house were played by citizens for more amusement the penalty of defeat being a treat and we are also satisfied that Neble did not employ or use the slave as a regular bar keeper: but that he occasionally waited on customers when his employer was otherwise engaged: and we feel assured from all of the circumstances that his case is one deserving of executive clemency We therefore pray that his fine in the gaming case being $200 -- & in the case for permitting the slave to sell liquor being $20 -- be remitted signed by the Jurors & others this 16th day of May 1863

J. L Mager
Jas M Woods
John M Sharp
L C Rankin
George Kimbrough
Wm M,, Terry
George Reneker
J. S. Frissell
W A Stuart
H Nesbit
George Sidle
John Bruce
P F L St Thomas
Morrison Smith
David Granelbut
John Wright
C Walton
M Marshall
J Newton Smith
Geo. Morrison
Jno R Smith
James F. Ware
N. L. Broadwill
J. T. McClintock
A L Furnish
Wm K Ralston
Luke Adams
C. G. Sand
Oscar J. Poindexter
J. E. Dickey
J. W. Peck
Wm Hutchenson
Ben Cummins
John C Wilson
Wm F. Laughlin
James Oder --
James Van Deren
Robert Kimbrough
H, Cox
Wm H. Stewart
N B Wilson
Wm Lowry
George Million
B C Day
A T McNees
Hamilton Bruce
Wm F Carelen

Harrison Cir. Ct
H. C. Neble
To } Petition
Gov. Robinson
$200 } Gaming
The fine for Two Hundred dollars remitted except Costs. The remaining twenty dollar fine refused

J F Robinson
Remission Issd
May 20th 1863
